member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ComReleaser
member.summary: A Base object to assist devloping against COM objects that require a deterministic release pattern.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ComReleaser.#ctor
member.summary: Default Constructor

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ComReleaser.Finalize
member.summary: Destructor

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ComReleaser.ManageLifetime(System.Object)
member.summary: Manages the lifetime of any COM object. The method will deterministically release the object during the dispose process.
member.remarks: Marshal.ReleaseComObject will be called during the disposal process on this Interface pointer until its RCW reference count becomes 0. NOTE: Do not add ServerObject interfaces like IMapServer, IGeocodeServer, IMapServerLayout or IMapServerObjects.
member.param: The COM object to manage.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ComReleaser.Dispose
member.summary: Implementation of IDisposable method Dispose() The Dispose method should release all the resources that it owns for unmanaged code resources.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ComReleaser.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose method implementation from IDisposable Interface
member.param: Boolean value indicating to the method whether or not it should also dispose managed objects

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ComReleaser.ReleaseCOMObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Decrements the reference count to zero of the supplied runtime callable wrapper.
member.param: The COM object to release.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnectionFactory
member.summary: Used as factory to create a new connection to an ArcGIS Server.
member.remarks: This method is used to create a new connection to an ArcGIS Server machine without requiring a Map or other control on the page.

member.summary: Default Constructor.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnectionFactory.CreateServerConnection(System.String,ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Identity)
member.summary: Returns an ArcGIS Server connection instance.
member.returns: Server connection instance type-casted to IServerConnection.
member.param: Contains the name of the ArcGIS host.
The identity with credentials for connecting to the ArcGIS Server.

remarks.para: The serverObjectType value should be a string value matching one of the constants in ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.Constants:

remarks.para: The serverObjectType value should be a string value matching one of the constants in ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.ArcGISServer.Constants:
The extensions for a service may include:

The type name of the Server Object.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection.GetDataFramesFromMapServerObject(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the names of dataframes from a map server object.
member.returns: An array of dataframe names as strings
member.remarks: An ArcGIS Server map service is based on a map document (usually an .mxd file) that can contain multiple data frames, each with separate sets of layers and symbology. This method retrieves a list of these data frames.
member.param: The map server object's name.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection.GetDataFramesFromMapServerObject(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the dataframes from a map server object
member.param: The map server object's name.
If true and only one data frame is in the map, returns "(default)".
member.returns: An array list of map server object names as strings

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection.GetDataFramesFromMapServerObject(ESRI.ArcGIS.Carto.IMapServer)
member.summary: Gets the dataframes from a map server object
member.returns: An array of data frame names as strings.
member.remarks: An ArcGIS Server map service is based on a map document (usually an .mxd file) that can contain multiple data frames, each with separate sets of layers and symbology. This method retrieves a list of these data frames.
member.param: The map server object.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection.GetDataFramesFromMapServerObject(ESRI.ArcGIS.Carto.IMapServer,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the dataframes from a map server object
member.param: The map server object.
If true and only one data frame is in the map, returns "(default)".
member.returns: An array list of map server object names as strings

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection.IsMapServer(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified server object is a map server.
member.param: The name of the server object.
member.returns: True if server object is a map server. False if it is not.
member.remarks: Please note that a service name can be shared by more than one type of server. For example, a GP service and a map service can be named the same.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection.IsGeocodeServer(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified server object is a geocode server.
member.param: The name of the server object.
member.returns: True if server object is a geocode server. False if it is not.
member.remarks: Please note that a service name can be shared by more than one type of server. For example, a GP service and a map service can be named the same.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection.IsGPServer(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified server object is a geoprocessing server.
member.param: The name of the server object.
member.returns: True if server object is a geoprocessing server. False if it is not.
member.remarks: Please note that a service name can be shared by more than one type of server. For example, a GP service and a map service can be named the same.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection.GetServiceTypes(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the service types for the specified service name.
member.returns: A List of the types of service supported, such as "MapServer", "GeocodeServer", or "GPServer".
member.param: Name of the service
